oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Randomized longitudinal study to test the effect of pre-calving vaccination of range beef cows and other factors on the incidence of calf pneumonia
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Smith, D. R.
Woolums, A. R.
Grotelueschen, D. M.
Thomson, L. E.
Noffsinger, T.
Stokka, G. L.
Maddux, J.
Hill, H.
Rowley, L.
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Pneumonia
beef calves
vaccination
incidence
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Pneumonia is a leading cause of sickness and death in beef calves prior to feedlot entry. The objective of this study was to test the effect of pre-calving vaccination of beef cows and other factors on the subsequent incidence of calf pneumonia on a ranch with a history of incidence of calf pneumonia > 10%.
oai_dc:dc.dc:source: American Association of Bovine Practitioners Conference Proceedings; 2013; 179
